definition: -ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
to act as host/to do the honors

sentences.english: The landlord would smile and reduce interest by 2 percent on the peasant's debt.
sentences.chinese: 地主装出笑脸，把农民所欠的债款减去二厘利。

sentences.english: Strictly prohibit landlords and rich peasants from sneaking into the peasant associations and poor peasant leagues.
sentences.chinese: 严禁地主富农分子混入农民协会和贫农团。

sentences.english: All the farmers hate the wicked landlord.
sentences.chinese: 所有的农民都憎恨这个缺德的地主。

sentences.english: The landlords who live in mansions want to have their lands returned.
sentences.chinese: 生活在别墅里的地主们要求归还他们的土地。

sentences.english: She had to sign an indenture to sell herself, because she owed money to the landlord .
sentences.chinese: 由于欠地主家的钱，她不得已签了卖身契。

sentences.english: The abolition of capitalism and landlordism in Cuba represented an enormous step forward.
sentences.chinese: 古巴对资本主义和地主制度的废除是一个很大的进步。

sentences.english: I had hoped that the landowner would have heeded that call.
sentences.chinese: 我希望地主能注意到这样的呼唤。

sentences.english: The farmers, having guaranteed not to kill him, the landlord returned.
sentences.chinese: 后来，地主得悉群众担保不杀他，于是决定回村去。

sentences.english: Pick up your Host Organizing Committee gift bag with the voucher in your registration packet.
sentences.chinese: 领取你的地主筹备委员会礼品袋连同你注册袋之收据。

sentences.english: Cases from the landlord Yanglao Matsui Department received information, then go to Li Zhuang search.
sentences.chinese: 松井从地主杨老宗处得到情报，遂去李庄搜索。

sentences.english: In areas occupied by the army, the landlords also go under easily.
sentences.chinese: 在八路军进驻的地区，地主也不难制服。

sentences.english: His father was a wealth sugar planter and his mother came from the Cuban landed gentry.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸是富裕的甘蔗种植园主，妈妈来自古巴地主阶级。

sentences.english: The rich landlord cheated the poor old woman of her land.
sentences.chinese: 富裕的地主从那位贫穷的老妇人那里骗走了土地。

sentences.english: He used to be a long-term labourer for a landlord.
sentences.chinese: 他早先给地主扛过长活。

sentences.english: And landowners keep wallowing in royalties whether the driller makes a profit or not.
sentences.chinese: 不管钻机是否盈利，地主们只沉迷于收取土地使用费。

sentences.english: In the first act the curtain goes up on a dungeon in a landlord's house.
sentences.chinese: 第一幕启幕时，舞台上现出了地主家里的一个地牢。

definition: local bosses, shady gentry (idiom); dominant local mafia
rich peasant/social class of people farming their own land, intermediate between land-owner class 地主[di4 zhu3] and poor peasant 貧農|贫农[pin2 nong2]
a scholar or government official living in one's village/a village gentleman/squire
movable property/money and belongings/non-real estate assets
